block.p: Jocelyn Sue Newmark and James Richard Gross, elementary school teachers, were married yesterday at the Harmonie Club in Manhattan. Dr. Richard S. Chapin, an associate rabbi of Congregation Emanu-El in New York, officiated.
The bride teaches the fourth grade at the Pound Ridge (N.Y.) Elementary School; the bridegroom teaches the fifth grade at the Horace Mann School in Riverdale, the Bronx.

Jocelyn Sue Newmark and James Richard Gross, elementary school teachers, were married yesterday at the Harmonie Club in Manhattan. Dr. Richard S. Chapin, an associate rabbi of Congregation Emanu-El in New York, officiated.
The bride teaches the fourth grade at the Pound Ridge (N.Y.) Elementary School; the bridegroom teaches the fifth grade at the Horace Mann School in Riverdale, the Bronx.

Mrs. Gross, 29, graduated from the University of Michigan. She is a daughter of Sherry Newmark of Edgewater, N.J., and Martin Newmark of Brookside, N.J., and a stepdaughter of Jane Newmark. The bride's father is a partner in Broderick, Newmark & Grather, a law firm in Morristown, N.J. Her mother is a tutor of English as a second language in Edgewater.

Mr. Gross, 32, graduated from the University of Pennsylvania. He is a son of Margaret S. Nathan of Rockport, Tex., and Peter M. Gross of New York, and a stepson of Gaye Slater Gross and of Cyrus H. Nathan. His mother is the president of the Edna and Monroe C. Gutman Foundation in New York, which provides money for medical and educational institutions. His father is a financial analyst for the Gross Oil Corporation, a company that invests in oil exploration and development companies, in New York.
